Title: Instagram's AI now detects and protects teens, even if their profile says they're adults
Description: Instagram is expanding its use of AI to automatically place suspected teen accounts in Canada into protective settings.

Title: What a $9 billion takeover battle says about the next frontier in the AI arms race
Description: Core Scientific shareholders are pushing back on a $9 billion deal, arguing that in the AI era, electricity is the most valuable asset of all.

Title: I left my job at the world's biggest beer company for startup life. I knew Asia was the right place to do it.
Description:
He left behind a fast-track corporate career at AB InBev because the safe path felt too predictable.
Now, he's running a startup in Indonesia.

Title: Here's who gets Social Security payments this week on Sept. 24
Description:
The third wave of Social Security payments for the month of September is set to be sent this week.
Here's what recipients need to know.

Title: Key takeaways from Charlie Kirk's memorial service
Description: Tens of thousands packed State Farm Stadium on Sunday as President Donald Trump, Vice President JD Vance, Erika Kirk and more paid tribute to Charlie Kirk.

Title: Gizmodo Science Fair: A Rocket Engine That Turns Controlled Explosions Into Thrust
Description: Using supersonic shockwaves for combustion, the groundbreaking design could allow aircraft to travel up to six times the speed of sound.

Title: Gizmodo Science Fair: A New Pill to Treat Schizophrenia—the First in 50 Years
Description: Cobenfy is the first approved drug in about 50 years to treat schizophrenia with a novel approach.

Title: Gizmodo Science Fair: A Vaccine to Treat a Wide Variety of Fungal Infections
Description: A vaccine that shields mice from yeast infections could eventually protect humans against a broad range of deadly fungi.

Title: The Art of the Impersonal Essay, by Zadie Smith
Description: Zadie Smith, the author of “Swing Time,” “The Fraud,” and “Dead and Alive,” reflects on how the essay-writing habits of her school days still influence her writing today.

Title: Letters from Our Readers
Description: Readers respond to Louis Menand’s essay about James Baldwin, Leslie Jamison’s article about perfectionism, and Tad Friend’s report on biohackers.

Title: H. W. Fowler, the Autocrat of English Usage
Description:
Ben Yagoda discusses Henry W.
Fowler and how his “Dictionary of Modern English Usage” became a New Yorker style bible for a century.

Title: My House Burned in the L.A. Fires. What Happens Now?
Description: Dana Goodyear writes about losing her home, in the Pacific Palisades neighborhood of Los Angeles, in the January, 2025, wildfires, and efforts to rebuild the area.

Title: Ian McEwan Casts the Climate Crisis as a Story of Adultery
Description: His new novel, “What We Can Know,” imagines the historians of the twenty-second century, who long for the world that they’ve missed out on.

Title: Kmart's use of facial recognition to tackle refund fraud unlawful
Description: The Privacy Commissioner has found that Kmart breached Australians’ privacy by collecting their personal and sensitive information through a facial recognition technology system.

Title: Dying Light: The Beast review
Description:

Description:

Title: Vaccine Panel Overhaul, Head Trauma in Sports, and Strange Reproduction in Ants
Description: A revamped CDC advisory committee faces vaccine debates, studies reveal brain changes in athletes, and climate change drives deadly heat waves across Europe.

Title: Inside the Mysterious Smuggling of the El Ali Meteorite
